alert.note: Alert for Clay (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 10 at 9:14PM CDT until April 16 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... South Branch Buffalo River at Sabin affecting Clay County. Buffalo River near Dilworth affecting Clay County. Buffalo River near Hawley affecting Clay County. Wild Rice River (MN) at Hendrum affecting Norman County. Red Lake River at Crookston affecting Polk County. Two Rivers River near Hallock affecting Kittson County. .The rainfall today has been lower and further west than expected. This has delayed most of the expected river rises. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING TO SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Branch Buffalo River at Sabin. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning to Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, MINOR FLOOD STAGE. Flooding on road cut at old meander scar east of gage begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 10.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Tuesday morning to a crest of 13.5 feet Wednesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Friday afternoon. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
